result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert A Zehnder was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Robert A Zehnder was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 188 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine ($1,519) to be be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Oconomowoc Police Department and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
The Court recommends the Department of Corrections supervise the defendant in accordance with the standards defined in DOC Administrative Directive 10-04.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow transfer to Jefferson County.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Exhibits 1 - 6 from Post Conviction Motion Hearing held on 04/26/16 - Destroyed pursuant to statute.

Order Denying the Defendant's Postconviction Motion to Withdraw his Plea Based on Ineffectiveness of Trial Counsel.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus on 06/01/16

Attorney Melissa Zilavy appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Andrew Robert Hinkel appeared by phone means for Defendant Robert A Zehnder. 
Oral Ruling on:
Defense Postconviction Motion - Withdrawal of Plea (Based on Machner Issues).


Court finds/orders the following:   Reasons placed on the record.
Court is satisfied there has not been a showing that trial counsel was ineffective.
Therefore, Court Denies the Defense Motion for Postconviction.
Further reasons placed on the record.
Court signed the order.
Oral ruling on June 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Exhibits 1 - 6 from Post Conviction Motion Hearing held on 04/26/16 - Scanned.

From Post Conviction Motion Held on 04/26/16.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.
Oral ruling on May 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert A Zehnder in court with attorney Andrew Robert Hinkel.  
Post Conviction Motion filed by Defense - Request to Withdraw No Contest Plea/Ineffectiveness of Counsel (Issue of NGI was never explored and would have been a viable defense).
Defendant has completed his period of initial confinement and is currently on extended supervision.

State was not aware this matter was scheduled for a Machner Hearing - Thought they were just addressing whether or not the Motion could be filed and would ask for an adjournment if the matter proceeds to machner.
Atty. Hinkel objects to any adjournment of the machner and presented arguments.
Court Denies the State's request for adjournment.  Matter will proceed.
Court finds there is sufficient basis listed in the moving papers to proceed with the motion/testimony.

Witnesses Called:  Robert Penegor (Prior Counsel for the Defendant) and Robert A. Zehnder (Defendant).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Exhibits Marked:  1 - 6.
All exhibits offered and received by the court.


Neither party requested to submit any additional briefing/memorandum for the court's consideration.

Testimony Deemed Closed.
Atty. Hinkel presented closing arguments.
State presented closing arguments.
Response presented.

Court puts matter over for oral ruling.
Court will allow Atty. Hinkel to appear by phone for the next court date.
Court will not require the defendant's appearance on the next court date.






  Oral ruling scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Associated with Charge #2

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert A Zehnder in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Robert J. Penegor.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 4.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  18  Months.
Extended Supervision: 3 Years.
188  Days Credit.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Court will allow transfer to Jefferson County.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
The court recommends the Department of Corrections supervise the defendant in accordance with the standards defined in DOC Administrative Directive 10-04.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to City of Oconomowoc Police Department);
Fine:  $1,519
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250;
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  




Count 2:
Total Prison: 3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1.5  Years.
Extended Supervision: 2  Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
188 Days Credit.

Defendant is Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Court will allow transfer to Jefferson County
Same as count 1. 

6 Months D/L REVOCATION - Concurrent to count 1.

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
